channel.title: 342 framework - "OpenRS"
channel.description:
Alright, since I have recently obtained a 342 deob, I've decided to build a server for it for people to use. I've named the project OpenRS. I'd like to thank Graham for some help with the client.
So far I've gotten login, and once we get the rest of the 342 protocols documented I will implement those in the server (soon). The framework was not designed to perform incredibly well, I tried to keep it relatively simple so it wont intimidate people who try to use it. The client uses the 369 cache, as a 342 cache cannot be found.
[b]Client:[/b] http://subversion.assembla.com/svn/342refactor/ [b]Server:[/b] http://subversion.assembla.com/svn/openrs/
There is still much to do, but feel free to criticize it as long as you're being constructive, I want your feedback. :P

item.title: 342 framework - "OpenRS"
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“xEnt, post:9, topic:295448”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=391451.msg2916541#msg2916541 date=1250483677]
What is different between 317 and 342 out of curiosity?
[/quote]
25[/quote]

I should have seen that coming I guess.

blakeman8192:

There isn’t much difference other than the fact that it’s uncharted territory.

I don’t see why you would bother with it then when you could focus on something more useful, like a new engine or even the 317 Hyperion.

Read full topic

item.description:

ry60003333:

Just out of curiosity, are the landscape files encrypted in this version?

Why would they be… if they were, 377 maps would also be, but you wrote a 377 server, and you never came across it. Think.
